message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is about improving information retrieval using a new language model that captures word burstiness. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also discusses the use of a multivariate Polya process, which is a statistical model commonly used in natural language processing, suggesting that it could also be categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the efficiency of the model, suggesting it could be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the theoretical justification for combining term and document event spaces, which could suggest a category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
